case_vignette: A young Mediterranean teen brings her 4-year-old little brother to the Emergency Room because of a high temperature. Their parents are on their way to the hospital, but, in the meantime, she provides some of the history. She explains that he has been running a fever and limping for the past week. This morning, she had trouble awakening him, and she noticed some swelling and redness around his right ankle. In terms of his past medical history, she knows he has something wrong with his blood. He had to receive extra vaccinations as an infant, and he takes an antibiotic everyday. On exam in the ED, his temperature is 102.4 deg F (39.1 deg C), blood pressure is 90/60 mmHg, pulse is 123/min, and respirations are 22/min. He is lethargic, and his exam is noteworthy for erythema and edema in an area surrounding his distal shin.
question: What is the most likely diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Pediatrics and Neonatology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask simple 1 line questions, one question at a time. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I've been running a fever and I've started limping for the past week.
How old are you?
I'm 4 years old.
Have you had any recent injuries or trauma?
No, I haven't had any recent injuries or trauma.
Do you have any pain in your joints or muscles?
Yes, I have some swelling and redness around my right ankle.
Have you had any previous similar episodes of joint pain and swelling?
No, I have not had any similar episodes before.
Is there a family history of joint problems or arthritis?
I'm sorry, but I don't know about any family history of joint problems or arthritis.
Do you have any other symptoms such as rash, fatigue, or weight loss?
This morning I was hard to wake up, and I've been feeling really tired.

Thank you for answering all my questions. 

**Final Diagnosis:** Septic Arthritis

There is swelling and redness around the right ankle, which has not been previously experienced. The child has been feeling tired and difficult to wake up in the morning. There is no known family history of joint problems or arthritis.
